articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Remark Inciting Confrontation of Systems Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Remark Inciting Confrontation of Systems Flailed
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak said reunification can come at midnight like a burglar. A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea in a statement Friday branded it as an unpardonable provocation to the system and dignity of the DPRK, an insult to the nation's desire for reunification and a declaration of confrontation between systems.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Lee only seeks confrontation with his fellow countrymen and the collapse of the system in the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet group's "north policy" and confrontation moves are all prompted by its extreme bitterness toward the fellow countrymen and the foolish story of the "collapse of the north."
					
					 All open and closed talks and secret contacts that had been made between the authorities of the north and the south proved futile due to the sinister aim sought by the group of traitors.
					
					 The recent hideous incident of setting the leadership of the DPRK as a target clearly proves what phase the Lee group's bitterness toward the fellow countrymen has reached.
					
					 There are lots of countries and different social systems in the world but never had there been such hooligans as the Lee Myung Bak group who insulted the system and the dignity of the leadership of the fellow countrymen.
					
					  Lee's moves for confrontation between systems are a last-ditch effort of a political imbecile ignorant of the source of the vitality and the inexhaustible strength of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK can not but deal merciless blows at the Lee group if it persistently stands for the confrontation of systems.
					
					 The group will meet the collapse of its unpopular system and the end of the pro-U.S. puppet regime and the nation will gain reunification, its cherished desire.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Mozambican President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Mozambican President
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Armando Emilio Guebuza, president of Mozambique, on the 36th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between two countries would grow stronger, Kim in the message heartily wished the Mozambican president success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Pak Myong Chol Leaves to Ceremony the Women's World Cup
articles.content:
Pak Myong Chol Leaves to Ceremony the Women's World Cup 
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and his party left here Friday to attend the opening ceremony for the 2011 Women's World Cup in Germany.
					 Meanwhile, arriving here was a Liaoning provincial party and government delegation of China led by Chen Zhenggao, deputy secretary of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China and governor of the Liaoning Provincial People's Government.

articles.title: Performance of Servicemen's Wives Goes On
articles.content:
Performance of Servicemen's Wives Goes On
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- An art performance of servicemen's wives is going on at the Ponghwa Art Theater in Pyongyang, drawing many people.
					 The performers were selected from the second-term fourth contest of art groups of servicemen's wives.
					
					 The audience admire the performers for their mental world, excellent acting and high artistry, giving a big hand to them.  
					
					 The servicemen's wives had never dreamed of performing at a wonderful theater in the capital city of Pyongyang and winning enthusiastic applause from the audience.  
					
					 They reside in areas unfavorable for living conditions but do their utmost to assist their husbands and soldiers in their military service. 
					
					 Therefore, their songs and dances enjoy popularity among people who are eager to follow their way of life.
					
					 The contest of art groups of servicemen's wives has taken place every year since Juche 87 (1998).

articles.title: Koreans' Surnames Attest Their Homogeneity
articles.content:
Koreans' Surnames Attest Their Homogeneity 
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Surnames of the Korean people serve as one of what attest their national identity. 
					 Their surnames began to be used in the ancient time, only by royal families until the early period of three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla).
					
					 Later, the surnames became popular, taken by even commoners from the period of Koryo kingdom (918-1392).
					
					 Surnames most common in Korea are Kim, Ri, Pak, Choe and Jong.
					
					 There were some 30 two-letter surnames, but only 10 of them remain, including Tokko, Sonu and Hwangbo.
					
					 Surnames Hae, Song and Rye have existed from the ancient time.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists, during their colonial rule over Korea, established "offices for changing Koreans' names to Japanese ones" in all parts of the country, through which they forced Koreans to change their surnames and names. 
					
					 They, however, could not deprive the Korean people of their national identity.

articles.title: Advantages of Socialist Labor System
articles.content:
Advantages of Socialist Labor System
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung promulgated historic Labor Law 65 years ago, ushering in the new era of independent and creative labor life for the Korean people. 
					 The President indicated the most correct way of solving the labor issue in "The Ten-Point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland" long ago. On June 24, Juche 35 (1946) he promulgated "The Labor Law for the Workers and Office Employees in North Korea". It was a great event that declared the new and genuine labor system for the working people.
					
					 The socialist labor system in the DPRK has been steadily consolidated and developed along with the triumphant advance of the Korean revolution under the wise leadership of the party and the leader, demonstrating its advantages and vitality.
					
					 During the period of building a new country, the state made sure that responsible measures were taken for labor protection. It introduced social insurance and security systems and reassessed wages of workers despite the shortage of everything. These measures fuelled the enthusiasm and creativity of the working people, who became masters of the country. 
					
					 In 1951, during the Fatherland Liberation war, the state took a measure of rebuilding sanatoria and rest homes. 
					
					 The Cabinet made a decision on enforcing the Labor Law in the southern half of the republic in August 1950 and a decision on state social security in August 1951. 
					
					 A number of policies were put into force in the postwar period of rehabilitation and socialist construction. They included a Cabinet decision on increasing medical service for workers, technicians and office workers in June 1954 and a decision on cutting down working hours for nursing mothers in October 1966.
					
					 The Socialist Labor Law, original labor charter, was promulgated on April 18, 1978, in particular, indicating the way for the final solution of the labor issue. It marked an important occasion in giving full play to the advantages of the labor system in the DPRK.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il published the famous work "On Improving Labor Administration" on November 27, 1989. It brought about a new turn in thoroughly implementing the Socialist Labor Law and establishing the revolutionary way of working in the whole society. 
					
					 When the country was in difficult condition during the period of the arduous march and the forced march the state granted working people such social benefits as free education and free medical care systems as well as social insurance and security systems so that they might enjoy a worthwhile and cultured labor and emotional life.
					
					 Thanks to the policies of the party and the state for the people's labor safety the working places have been equipped with excellent facilities for labor protection. A high level of cultured practice in production and life has been established with full hygiene conditions.
					
					 Hundreds of sanatoria and rest homes have been built for the people in beauty spots including Mts. Myohyang, Chilbo, Kuwol and Jongbang.

articles.title: DPRK's Art Troupe Successfully Performs in China
articles.content:
DPRK's Art Troupe Successfully Performs in China
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Art Troupe of the DPRK made a performance tour of local areas of China to win acclamation by the audience.
					 They were given in Neijiang and Yibin cities of Sichuan Province and Wuhan and Yingching cities and Yingshan County of Hubei Province from June 3 to 19.
					
					 The places of performance were packed with officials of local party and power organs and people of different strata. 
					
					 After performances many officials mounted the stage to congratulate the artistes. 
					
					 An official in Chengdu City, Sichuan Province, after enjoying the performance, said the beautiful national dances vividly portrayed the optimistic and happy life of the Korean people. 
					
					 An official in charge of broadcasting of Yibin City, Sichuan Province noted the performance helped him know better about the noble idea and sentiment of the Korean people united close around their leader.
					
					 The head of a theatre of Yingshan County, Hubei Province called on the Chinese artistes to learn from the devotion and responsibility displayed by the Korean artistes. 
					
					 A party official of a district in Wuhan City, Hubei Province extended thanks to the Korean artistes for the fascinating performance and DPRK government for sending the excellent art troupe. 
					
					 An official of the district said the spirit displayed by the Korean artistes is the revolutionary spirit of the Korean people. 
					
					 An official of a theatre in Wuhan City, Hubei Province said under the meticulous leadership and deep care of Kim Jong Il the art of the DPRK has become a world-renowned one.

articles.title: U.S. Soldiers in S. Korea Do not Drink Underground Water in Their Base
articles.content:
U.S. Soldiers in S. Korea Do not Drink Underground Water in Their Base 
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- It was confirmed that the U.S. troops have not used underground water inside their base in Waegwan for drinking, south Korean CBS reported on June 22, adding defoliant is believed to have been buried in the base.
					 The commander of the U.S. 8th Army has so far asserted the U.S. troops in the military base in Waegwan drink underground water inside the base to prove that the water is not contaminated, it said.
					
					 An expert organ, however, recently revealed the U.S. forces in the base pumped up water from the River Rakdong and filtered it before using it as drinking water, the report noted.
					
					 It urged the U.S. forces to explain the reason why they stopped using the underground water in their base.

articles.title: China Makes Efforts to Remove Aftermath of Flood Damage
articles.content:
China Makes Efforts to Remove Aftermath of Flood Damage 
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Armed Police Force in the southern area is conducting a positive drive to remove the aftermath of the flood damage.
					 The police set in motion a total of 20,000 soldiers, 2,000 vehicles and more than 400 lifeboats up to June 21 for rescue operations.
					
					 It evacuated at least 40,000 people, saved 48 drowning inhabitants and gave medical treatment to over 160, a report said.

articles.title: Iran Plans to Launch Three Satellites This Year
articles.content:
Iran Plans to Launch Three Satellites This Year
 Tehran, June 23 (KCNA) -- Iran will launch three more satellites in space by the end of Iranian calendar year, head of Iranian Space Agency said Thursday.
					 "We will take further steps in 2011 to meet our needs entirely," said Iranian President Ahmadinejad on Monday.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Yunnan Province, China
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Yunnan Province, China
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- A 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit Baoshan City, Yunnan Province, China on June 20.
					 The epicenter was about 10 km deep.

articles.title: Germans Protest U.S. Blockade against Cuba
articles.content:
Germans Protest U.S. Blockade against Cuba
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of activists with the Cuba solidarity movement in Germany demonstrated outside the Brandenburg Gate to protest the U.S. economic, commercial and financial blockade imposed on Cuba for over 50 years.
					 They urged the U.S. to immediately lift the blockade.

articles.title: Austrian Organizations Urge S. Korea to Make Policy Switchover
articles.content:
Austrian Organizations Urge S. Korea to Make Policy Switchover 
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Austrian organizations urged the present south Korean authorities to make a switchover in their policy in the spirit of the June 15 North-South joint declaration. They released statements on June 15, the 11th anniversary of the joint declaration.
					 The Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation said the joint declaration serves as the banner of independent reunification to be invariably held aloft by all the Koreans.
					
					 It demanded the south Korean authorities stop the military provocation against the DPRK, ensure the right to wage trade union activities and immediately set free the detained trade union members.
					
					 It urged them to release such pro-reunification activists as Rev. Han Sang Ryol who is held behind bars for the mere reason that he visited the DPRK and conducted activities for reunification.
					
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna noted traitor Lee Myung Bak is resorting to every move to bedevil the north-south relations. Lee is increasing the danger of a war in the Korean Peninsula by faking up such conspiratorial farces as the "Cheonan" warship sinking and the Yonphyong Island shelling cases.

articles.title: China Urges S. Korea to Ensure Security of Civil Aviation
articles.content:
China Urges S. Korea to Ensure Security of Civil Aviation
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a news briefing on June 21 urged south Korea to ensure the security of civil airliners.
					 Recently a civil airplane, which took off in Chengdu of China, met accidental firing by the army of south Korea when it entered its sky.
					
					 The Chinese government had already expressed apprehension over this case to the south Korean side through diplomatic channel, the spokesman noted.
					
					 The south Korean side should take an effective step to prevent recurrence of such case so as to reliably ensure the safety of civil airplanes and passengers, he said.

articles.title: Israeli War Maneuvers Aggravate Regional Situation
articles.content:
Israeli War Maneuvers Aggravate Regional Situation
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Israel is aggravating the regional situation through escalated war maneuvers.
					 The Israeli army started the military exercises in the country as a whole on June 19 allegedly to cope with someone's missile attack.
					
					 The Israeli authorities are reportedly hurling even civilians into the exercises which will last for one week.

articles.title: Probe into Army Accidental Firing at Passenger Plane Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Army Accidental Firing at Passenger Plane Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on June 20 carried an editorial urging a probe into the case of accidental firing at a passenger plane by the puppet army.
					 At dawn of June 17 the marines of south Korea stationed in Kanghwa County's Kyodong Island fired rifle bullets at a passenger plane of Asiana Airlines on normal flight for ten minutes, the paper noted.
					
					 A lot of doubts are arising over this case which might cause a big disaster, but the Defense Ministry tries to downplay it as a "sudden happening", it charged.
					
					 Those concerned of the navigation company are unanimous in saying that the case is "unprecedented and fathomless", it said, adding:
					
					 To begin with, it is not clear why they fired at the passenger plane on routine flight.
					
					 The military has asserted that it was due to bad weather from dense fog at dawn.
					
					 Just after the case it claimed the passenger plane might be deviated from route, seeking to avoid the blame, but later admitted its error.
					
					 It is also hard to understand the fact that the case was opened to public by media, not by the military or the company side. It is likely that the military tried to conceal the case and threatened the company side not to open it to public.
					
					 The military should open to public the truth about the case.

articles.title: Communications Satellite Launched in China
articles.content:
Communications Satellite Launched in China
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- China on June 21 launched Long March-3 carrier rocket to successfully put communications satellite Zhongxing-10 into its orbit.
					 The launch of satellite was made at the Xichang Satellite Launch Center.
					
					 The satellite will provide communications and TV broadcasts for China and the Asia-Pacific region.

articles.title: Plane of S. Korean Puppet Army Crashes
articles.content:
Plane of S. Korean Puppet Army Crashes
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A plane of the south Korean puppet air force crashed while being in military drill in the sky above Koun-ri, Chongwon County, North Chungchong Province on June 21, according to south Korean KBS.
					 Its pilots were reportedly confirmed to be dead.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Great Patriotic War Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Great Patriotic War Marked in Russia
 Moscow, June 23 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Russia on June 22 to mark the 70th anniversary of the start of the Great Patriotic War.
					 Russian President Dmitri Medvedev laid a wreath before the Eternal Flame at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in the Alexander Garden in Moscow.
					
					 Attending the wreath-laying ceremony were members of the government, representatives of the State Duma and the Federation Council, war veterans and representatives of public organizations. 
					
					 Then followed a parade by soldiers of the Moscow Garrison.
					
					 Meanwhile, there were such events as ceremonies of laying wreaths and flowers at the tombs of the unknown soldier and burying the unearthed remains of fallen Soviet Army soldiers in other cities of Russia on the same day.

articles.title: Cooperation among Nations Boosted
articles.content:
Cooperation among Nations Boosted
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Uganda and Kenya on June 20 decided to sign an agreement on the return of Kenyan refugees from Uganda.
					 On June 17 Slovakia and Ukraine agreed to cooperate in the field of energy.

articles.title: Economic Stagnation in Japan and Italy
articles.content:
Economic Stagnation in Japan and Italy
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Japan's department store sales in May fell 2.4 percent from a year earlier on a same-store basis, the Japan Department Stores Association said on Jun 17.
					 This is because economic depression made consumers reluctant to go shopping.
					
					 Meanwhile, Italian industrial orders in April fell 6.4 percent from March, Italy's statistics agency Istat said on Monday.
					
					 Industrial enterprises are in depression due to the reduction of orders, it noted.

articles.title: China Attaches Importance to Handling of Complaints
articles.content:
China Attaches Importance to Handling of Complaints
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- Ma Kai, state councilor and secretary-general of the State Council of China, stressed the need to develop a political sense of responsibility for handling of appeal.
					 At a recent meeting he said that this work is an important way for linking the party and government with the popular masses and a major means for the party and government to catch the desire and demand of the people.
					
					 Officials in charge of this work should have higher sense of political responsibility for it and focus their activity on lower units to effectively protect legal rights and interests of the masses and grasp the social situation and public opinion in time, he said.

articles.title: China Strives to Prevent Geological Calamity
articles.content:
China Strives to Prevent Geological Calamity
 Beijing, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government on June 17 announced, through Internet, a decision of the State Council on strengthening the work to prevent geological disasters.
					 The decision called for raising the consciousness and capability of preventing geological calamity among the society and promoting this work in an overall way to enhance the nation's level of countering geological disasters.

articles.title: Russia Slams Affront to Monument to Soviet Army in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Russia Slams Affront to Monument to Soviet Army in Bulgaria
 Moscow, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry in a statement Wednesday slashed at the affront to the monument to the Soviet Army recently committed in Bulgaria.
					 It is regrettable that such action is unabated in Bulgaria and certain forces of this country attempt to steadily foster it, the statement said, expressing belief that it is not a reflection of the Bulgarian people's sentiment.
					
					 The statement hoped that the Bulgarian authorities would surely take measures to prevent such practice and find out and punish those responsible for the case.

articles.title: Former U.S. Deputy State Secretary on Japanese Gov.'s Lack of Leadership
articles.content:
Former U.S. Deputy State Secretary on Japanese Gov.'s Lack of Leadership
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Armitage, former deputy secretary of the U.S. Department of State, expressed concern over the lack of leadership of the Japanese government at a recent interview by the Jiji Press. Ltd.

articles.title: European Commission Official Describes Fukushima Nuclear Crisis as Man-Made Disaster
articles.content:
European Commission Official Describes Fukushima Nuclear Crisis as Man-Made Disaster 
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The accident at Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant was caused not only by nature but also man, said a member of the European Commission at a press interview on June 20.
					 The plant was put out of control right after the accident, he said.
					
					 He said no one can rule out the possibility of the worst situation.

articles.title: DPRK Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Books Donated to Russia
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of donating DPRK books took place in Ulyanovsk City, Russia on June 14.
					 Attending it were officials of the V. I. Lenin Memorial Museum in the city and the Stroimashintorg Company and masses and staff of the DPRK embassy in Moscow.
					
					 General secretary Kim Jong Il's works and books on his feats were conveyed to the curator of the museum.
					
					 We deem it a great honor to receive the precious books on the 47th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the curator said, adding:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was the great leader who wisely organized and led the Korean people's struggle for the socialist revolution and construction and conducted energetic activities for the development the world revolution and communist movement.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a distinguished leader in the present era. He not only defends and glorifies the feats of the President but invariably leads the socialist cause despite all sorts of the imperialists' arbitrary practices, sanctions and pressure.
					
					 I wish the Korean people greater success in the work to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, true to the behests of the President.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Marked by Ecuadorian Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Marked by Ecuadorian Organization
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People issued a bulletin on June 7 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Not only the Koreans but the international community hailed the joint declaration published by the north and the south of Korea for its reunification on June 15, 11 years ago, the bulletin said.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" is the basic spirit of the joint declaration, it noted.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The joint declaration serves as a great programme for Korea's reunification as it indicates the way of turning the north-south relations of confrontation into those of reconciliation and cooperation and achieving the common prosperity of the nation.
					
					 The adoption of the joint declaration opened the new era of independent reunification of Korea, demonstrating its vitality.
					
					 But the anti-reunification forces of south Korea challenged the joint declaration.
					
					 The present south Korean regime refused dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south and turned the Korean Peninsula into the world's most dangerous hotspot in collusion with the U.S.
					
					 The history clearly proves the implementation of the joint declaration is the only way of averting a war and achieving peace and reunification of the peninsula.

articles.title: Praised by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Praised by Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A British organization and the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted special write-ups on their Internet homepages to mark the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on June 13 posted on its Internet homepage an article with a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is a great leader with extraordinary wisdom, traits and distinguished qualification recognized by the world, the article said under heading "Peerless political elder".
					
					 During the 47 year-long history of his leadership over the WPK he has strengthened it into the party of President Kim Il Sung both in name and reality and defended the dignity and sovereignty of the nation and opened the new era of building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification with his Songun revolutionary leadership, the article noted.
					
					 The historic inter-Korean summit and the adoption of the joint declaration 11 years ago were a great event that created a worldwide sensation, said the bulletin under another heading "Long live the June 15 era of independent reunification". The world called it "Kim Jong Il shock" and "historic event" at that time, it added.
					
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain on June 4 posted on its Internet homepage "One Corea Network" articles such as "June 15 story" with a portrait of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Feats Praised by Committee Study of the Juche Idea
articles.content:
Feats Praised by Committee Study of the Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Firenze Group of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a bulletin on June 11 on the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The Korean people have unswervingly followed the path chosen by themselves under the uplifted red flag without the slightest vacillation and hesitation, the bulletin said under heading "Kim Jong Il, an outstanding political activist". The credit for this goes to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who has successfully carried forward the cause of President Kim Il Sung, it said, and continued:
					
					 Kim Jong Il showed his disposition as a distinguished statesman while leading the overall work of the country from long ago. The secret of the DPRK shining as a socialist country centered on the popular masses lies in the fact that he has embodied all the requirements of the Juche idea in all fabrics of social life.
					
					 The Juche idea that has been developed and enriched by him is an original idea centered on the man, the bulletin said, adding the imperialists dare not provoke the DPRK even though they talk about "globalization".

articles.title: Start of Work at WPK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Start of Work at WPK Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Organs of political parties of Palestine and Russia carried special write-ups and articles on the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The June issue of Ilal Amam, the organ of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, carried a photograph of Kim Jong Il and a special write-up.
					
					 The magazine in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, June 19, 1964" said from the first day he started his work at the C.C., the WPK, Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung and lived an ordinary life as a soldier who upholds the intention of the President without expecting privilege and preference.
					
					 The magazine in an article titled "Immortal Banner of Korea's Reunification" introduced in detail the idea of "By our nation itself", the basic spirit of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					
					 The sixth issue of Serp I Molot, the organ of the Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks in Russia, carried an article titled "The DPRK". Kim Jong Il has successfully embodied the idea and line of the President, the article noted.
					
					 The Juche idea, the Songun idea is a cornerstone of the domestic and foreign policies of the DPRK and it arouses warm support and sympathy from the world progressives, the article noted.
					
					 Thanks to the unremitting efforts of Kim Jong Il, the June 15 joint declaration was adopted, the article said, adding the great positive events took place in the movement of Korea's reunification after the publication of the declaration.

articles.title: Anniversary of Inter-Korean Joint Declaration Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Inter-Korean Joint Declaration Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Denmark and Finland and a reading session in Democratic Congo between June 5 and 14 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said successes unimaginable in the past were made in the inter-Korean relations since the historic declaration was adopted thanks to general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak conservative forces, however, pushed the north-south relations to a collapse after coming to power, he said, adding this is a perfidy to the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration signed by the north and the south as well as an anti-reunification criminal act.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, referring to the significance of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, expressed his will to strengthen the solidarity movement to support the cause of the Korean people for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the future, too.
					
					 Kanga Ngerien Jerom, chairman of the Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, read out President Kim Il Sung's famous work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country".
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Denmark.

articles.title: Work Off Press in Nepala
articles.content:
Work Off Press in Nepal
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese paper Arpan on June 17 carried the second part of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction". 
					 The second part of the work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the issue of preserving the stand of patriotism and the principle of national independence in the revolution and the construction. It also specifies the tasks and ways to provide the driving force and carry on struggle against imperialism and dominationism.

articles.title: Opera revolucionaria Mar de Sangre
articles.content:
Opera revolucionaria Mar de Sangre
 Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ATCC) -- Han transcurrido 40 anos desde cuando en Corea se creo la opera revolucionaria Mar de Sangre.
					 La opera fue adaptada del drama homonimo creado por el Presidente Kim Il Sung en el periodo de la lucha armada antijaponesa.
					
					 El jefe de seccion del Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre, Kim Yong Rok (de 66 anos de edad) explico a la ATCC el curso de adaptacion de la opera:
					
					 Despues de adaptar al cine el drama Mar de Sangre, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il presento a principios de la decada de 1970 la tarea de crear no una opera al estilo clasico europeo, sino una nueva popular conveniente a la realidad de nuestro pais, e ilumino minuciosamente los remedios para el respecto. 
					
					 De esta manera, se creo una nueva opera revolucionaria al estilo coreano, en la cual estan versificadas todas las canciones y musicas y se aplican el pangchang (coro del foso), las danzas y la escenografia corriente, y la orquesta combinada de instrumentos musicales nacionales con los occidentales.
					
					 La opera muestra el desarrollo de una mujer y la lucha antijaponesa del pueblo coreano por la liberacion nacional a base de la lucha armada antijaponesa en la decada de 1930 y ensena la verdad de que surge la resistencia donde hay opresiones y que la revolucion es la unica via para las masas trabajadoras oprimidas.
					
					 Aunque pasaron varios decenios, la opera tiene gran vitalidad y fuerza atractiva y llama a la gente a la lucha por la construccion de nueva sociedad. 
					
					 Ahora se ofrece en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang la funcion de esta opera, con motivo del 40o aniversario de su creacion y del Conjunto Operistico Mar de Sangre.

articles.title: Sistema de trabajo socialista de Corea
articles.content:
Sistema de trabajo socialista de Corea 
 Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ATCC) -- Ya transcurrieron los 65 anos desde cuando el Presidente Kim Il Sung promulgo la historica ley de trabajo para asegurar al pueblo coreano la vida laboral independiente y creativa. 
					 El Presidente ilumino en el Programa de Diez Puntos de la Asociacion para la Restauracion de la Patria la via mas correcta para la solucion del problema del trabajo y promulgo el 24 de junio del 35 (1946) de la Era Juche la "Ley del trabajo para los obreros y empleados del Norte de Corea". 
					
					 El sistema laboral socialista de Corea vino fortaleciendose constantemente junto con el avance victorioso de la revolucion y bajo la sabia guia del partido y el lider, manifestando plenamente su superioridad y  vitalidad. 
					
					  En el periodo de la construccion de una nueva patria, el Estado tomo las medidas de proteccion laboral, establecio el sistema de seguro social y el de jubilacion y elevo los salarios de los obreros. Tales politicas laborales practicadas aun en la situacion escasa de lo todo estimularon mas el entusiasmo y las facultades creadoras de los trabajadores. 
					
					 En el 1951, periodo de la enconada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953), se tomaron las medidas estatales para reconstruir los sanitarios y las casas de descanso destruidos. 
					
					 Ademas, se aprobaron la resolucion del Consejo de Ministros sobre la aplicacion de la ley del trabajo en la zona surena de la republica (en agosto de 1950) y la otra sobre la jubilacion estatal (en agosto de 1951).
					
					 En los periodos de la restauracion posbelica y la construccion socialista se aplicaron muchas politicas laborales como la resolucion del Consejo de Ministros de fomentar la asistencia medica para los obreros, tecnicos y oficinistas (en junio de 1954) y la de disminuir las horas laborales de obreras madres (en octubre de 1966).
					
					   En particular, la ley de trabajo socialista promulgada el 18 de abril de 1978 manifesto sin reservas la superioridad del sistema laboral de nuestro pais. 
					
					   El Dirigente Kim Jong Il publico el 27 de noviembre de 1989 la obra "Para mejorar e intensificar la labor de administracion del trabajo", que registro un nuevo cambio en materializar cabalmente la ley del trabajo socialista y establecer en toda la sociedad el ambiente revolucionario de la vida laboral. 
					
					   En el periodo de la marcha penosa, la forzada, el Estado practico invariablemente el sistema de educacion y asistencia medica gratuitas y dispenso los beneficios estatales y sociales segun el sistema estatal de seguro social y el de jubilacion, de manera que los trabajadores gozaran a sus anchas de la digna vida laboral y cultural. 
					
					   Gracias a la politica de proteccion laboral de caracter popular del Partido y el Estado, se acondicionaron magnificamente las instalaciones de seguridad y de proteccion del trabajo y las condiciones de higiene industrial y se establecieron en alto nivel la cultura de vida y la de produccion.
					
					   En los lugares pintorescos del pais como los montes Myohyang, Chilbo, Kuwol y Jongbang se acondicionaron bien centenares de sanitarios y centros de descanso, donde cada ano pasan dias alegres cientos de miles de trabajadores de distintos estratos.

articles.title: Accidente de Fukushima fue causado por hombre, opina funcionario de UE
articles.content:
Accidente de Fukushima fue causado por hombre, opina funcionario de UE
 Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ATCC) -- En una rueda de prensa concedida el dia 20, un miembro de la Comision de la Union Europea, insistio en que el accidente de la central nuclear de Fukushima-1 es el desastre causado por el hombre.
					 Ese accidente se atribuye no solo a los fenomenos naturales sino tambien al hombre, dijo el apuntando que la central siniestrada cayo en la situacion incontrolable.
					
					 No se puede descartar la posibilidad de la peor situacion, alarmo.
